title: Why are people saying that you can dodge syndra's stun?
body:
It's just impossible in theory; you don't need to know anything else than:

-syndra's E pushes her spheres to 1100 range at 2500 speed, no matter where she puts her spheres.
the range of her E is 700, if she puts her Q on max range and then presses E, the spheres will move by 400 at a speed of 2500, in other world thanks to the formula t= d/v , her E will reach you in 400/2500 seconds, (0.16 seconds)

if you're character has 400 ms, he can move at a speed of 400 units/seconds, which is effectively 64 units/0.16 seconds

the only way you can dodge her E is because:
-the player is dumb af, and didn't put his Q at max range of his E
-the player is dumb af, and didn't put his Q right behind you (and then missed his E)

replies.body:
Couple of notes here:

* Syndra's spheres get moved at a speed of 1600 once they've been hit by her E. The E itself has a speed of 2500, spheres and units it knocks back do not.
* Q cast also serves as a warning indicator of incoming stun, with a 0.5s delay between cast and appearance (it doesn't instantly appear and start moving).

That's not an argument by itself that Syndra's stun combo is or isn't appropriately dodgeable, wanted to provide additional information though. Would also suggest that as WoonStruck mentions the W can be a bigger factor in reliable stuns than the straight QE combo.

In terms of Syndra's balance I expect she'll be on our list of 'champs we need to at least consider' in 6.23.

Okay, anybody that actually knows how to play Syndra knows that you set up your stun with W. 

If Syndra sets it up with W, its literally impossible to dodge. 
_________________
Q->E isn't a big deal. Move perpendicular to her and cast location for the orb. 

W->E is a big deal. Especially once she can carry more than one orb. She can put that orb anywhere from any angle, heavily slowing at the same time. Even if you dodge W, you're getting smacked with that stun. Not to mention how you can cast W to lead their movement, then pop a Q into stun. 

A decent Syndra player doesn't even have to be good at landing skillshots unless they're going for absolute max-range stuns. Her stun is free.

Because Syndra's stun has always been that way and no one was complaining about it. No one was saying Syndra's stun was OP, or that Syndra herself was OP, until she got played at worlds.

It's still amazing what worlds can do to champions. Syndra has been flying by with her negative winrates since last season. No one cared about Syndra. But as soon as she is picked in worlds, the boards is flooded with "Nerf Syndra," "Syndra OP," "Sydnra stun impossible to dodge," etc.

Like seriously? Get outta here with that BS. Where were all of you when Syndra was doing the EXACT SAME THING last season and earlier this season? All the Mage update did was make her ball management easier, but any half-decent Syndra player could do that easily way before then.

>Syndra has been flying by with her negative winrates since last season.

Since her release, with occassional one week-long spikes to 50%.

I get that a lot of people do just cry a lot like that, but just because she wasn't played as often doesn't mean she wasn't always strong.

You forget a couple of things, too. One, her mage update, whilst it seems small, was pretty good. Getting to move 3 spheres at any time to set up a really wide stun (which before hand would require some careful preparation) is a big buff. On top of that, she wasn't played a lot because she used to be quite buggy, which they sorted out. 

There are also some champions that make people angry whenever they become prominent - one of those is Syndra. Mostly because she has a great aoe stun on top of one of the biggest single target nukes. That isn't a skill shot. I'm sure you can see how that irritates people.

This entire topic is predicated on the enemy being stunned possessing no capacity to predict, juke, or otherwise fakeout the Syndra player. Turns out if you're not moving before a gun fires, you can't dodge the bullet.

Syndra's stun combo (Q+E) is mechanically slow to activate compared to some others (Morgana Q, Viktor E, and similar skillshots) because it relies on two separate abilities firing together. If sphere are already on the ground, it is at comparable speed, but relies on a physical object that must have a line draw between Syndra, her sphere, and her target.

W's repositioning of spheres is a powerful mix up tool, but that too is mechanically slow. Long range W's take around a second of flight time before they can be launched for a stun, not only broadcasting position but also giving generous room to escape to a manuevering enemy. Simply running away in a straight line, often a bad idea, is perfectly feasible here because ... Syndra cannot long range snipe people with W. The skill is too slow for that, specifically. In melee combat where this combo is the strongest, however, it gives Syndra a significant secondary tool in protecting herself.

I do agree the new W passive, which allows multi-sphere throws, is too powerful. It overloads her stun combo by removing the necessity of sphere management and positioning, which intrinsically slowed that combo down a fair bit. There's no way to fix that except removing multi-sphere throws as a passive, franky.

Otherwise, for all useful purposes done by skilled Syndra players, her stun combos are mostly trap based. She dictates an area of control and then half relies on enemies screwing up. The other half is forcing her presence closer, which then directly allows for the first half of this equation to work. Pro-active behavior with her stun, compared to something like Morgana, is difficult to do against enemies who are prepared to deal with it.

Flash comboing, and the enemy flashing to sidestep the stun, for instance, would be a near loss situation unless some other factors overrode it.

Just because you don't know how to dodge something, doesn't mean it is completely impossible to dodge.

Not a single skillshot in the game can't be dodged. Even Tibbers or Unstoppable Force can be beat with a well timed flash.
